item.description: Say goodbye to configuration bottlenecks. Our new AI agent generates file filter configurations instantly, letting localization teams move faster than ever.

Introducing the BloxWeaver File Engineering Agent

Every localization manager knows the frustration. A new file format lands on your desk—maybe it's a complex JSON with nested HTML, an Excel sheet with specific metadata requirements, or some proprietary format your development team just started using. The translation work stops. Everything waits while you manually configure file filters or, worse, submit a support ticket and wait days for your technical team to set things up. item.title: Discussing Leadership and AI on MBN's A Class Act Podcast
item.description: Our founder David Meikle joins Shannon McKechnie on MBN Solution's A Class Act podcast for a wide-ranging conversation covering Leadership and Artificial Intelligence.
item.content:encoded:
Discussing Leadership and AI on MBN's A Class Act Podcast

We were delighted to join Shannon McKechnie on MBN Solution's podcast, A Class Act: Conversations in Data and Leadership. On the podcast our founder, David Meikle, reflects on the leadership lessons he learned introducing AI and automation into the translation industry nearly ten years before most businesses began facing the same challenges. It was a wide-ranging conversation covering the following main topics: How to lead teams through fear of AI and show its value. Why psychological safety is essential for innovation and high performance. How David rebuilt trust after leading a restructure early in his career. The leadership principles behind scaling from 12% to 98% online orders in a year. Why patience, adaptability, and strengths-based leadership matter most in change. item.content:encoded:
The Precision Content Series: Context Enrichment

Welcome back to The Precision Content Series, where we explore the essential pillars that enable organizations to deliver precision content at global scale. In our previous posts, we introduced the concept of precision content and examined the critical foundation of Content Processing and Filtering. Today, we turn our attention to what many consider the most transformative pillar: Context Enrichment. Context Enrichment represents the difference between good and great translation. It involves identifying and leveraging appropriate contextual information - whether actively integrated into translation production or provided as reference material to guide human translators and AI models toward more accurate, culturally appropriate outcomes. Building on the content processing capabilities we explored previously, context enrichment extends far beyond the immediate content being translated, drawing from multiple sources to create a rich understanding that enables truly precision localization. item.title: The Precision Content Series: What is Precision Content?
item.description: An introduction to precision content and why high-value materials require meticulous attention to linguistic nuance, cultural context, and technical accuracy during translation and localization.
item.content:encoded:
The Precision Content Series: What is Precision Content?

Over the past ten years, content creation and distribution have reached unprecedented scales. This expansion, driven by the increasing global nature of modern business, has brought both new opportunities and significant challenges in maintaining quality across languages and cultures. The rise of AI technologies, particularly in translation and localization, has created a complex landscape of possibilities and pitfalls. While AI has been part of the translation industry longer than most - with the original Transformer model designed specifically for machine translation - today's environment of heightened AI awareness has created new dynamics. Many vendors have leaned into the current AI hype cycle, emphasising large language models and automated solutions that promise quick, cheap translations. However, for organisations with high-value content, this approach often falls short of delivering the required quality and precision.
